Package net.kemitix.mon.result

Interface Result<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the result when a success
All Superinterfaces:
Functor<T,​Result<?>>
public interface Result<T> extends Functor<T,​Result<?>>
An Either type for holding a result or an error (Throwable).
Author:
Paul Campbell (pcampbell@kemitix.net)

  • Method Details

    • fromMaybe

      static <T> Result<T> fromMaybe​(Maybe<T> maybe, Supplier<Throwable> error)
      Creates a Result from the Maybe, where the Result will be an error if the Maybe is Nothing.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the Maybe and the Result
      Parameters:
      maybe - the Maybe the might contain the value of the Result
      error - the error that will be the Result if maybe is Nothing
      Returns:
      a Result containing the value of the Maybe when it is a Just, or the error when it is Nothing

    • toMaybe

      static <T> Maybe<T> toMaybe​(Result<T> result)
      Creates a Maybe from the Result, where the Result is a success, then the Maybe will contain the value.

      However, if the Result is an error then the Maybe will be nothing.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the Maybe and the Result
      Parameters:
      result - the Result the might contain the value of the Result
      Returns:
      a Result containing the value of the Maybe when it is a Just, or the error when it is Nothing

    • orElseThrow

      T orElseThrow() throws CheckedErrorResultException
      Extracts the successful value from the result, or throws the error within a CheckedErrorResultException.
      Returns:
      the value if a success
      Throws:
      CheckedErrorResultException - if the result is an error

    • orElseThrow

      <E extends Exception> T orElseThrow​(Class<E> type) throws E
      Extracts the successful value from the result, or throws the error Throwable.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of the checked exception to throw
      Parameters:
      type - the type of checked exception that may be thrown
      Returns:
      the value if a success
      Throws:
      E - if the result is an error

    • orElseThrowUnchecked

      T orElseThrowUnchecked()
      Extracts the successful value from the result, or throws the error in a UnexpectedErrorResultException.
      Returns:
      the value if a success

    • swap

      static <T> Result<Maybe<T>> swap​(Maybe<Result<T>> maybeResult)
      Swaps the inner Result of a Maybe, so that a Result is on the outside.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value that may be in the Result
      Parameters:
      maybeResult - the Maybe the contains a Result
      Returns:
      a Result containing a Maybe, the value in the Maybe was the value in a successful Result within the original Maybe. If the original Maybe is Nothing, the Result will contain Nothing. If the original Result was an error, then the Result will also be an error.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a Result

      Type Parameters:

      R - the type of the updated Result
      Parameters:

      f - the function to apply to the value

      void match​(Consumer<T> onSuccess, Consumer<Throwable> onError)
      Matches the Result, either success or error, and supplies the appropriate Consumer with the value or error.
      Parameters:
      onSuccess - the Consumer to pass the value of a successful Result to
      onError - the Consumer to pass the error from an error Result to

    • maybe

      Result<Maybe<T>> maybe​(Predicate<T> predicate)
      Wraps the value within the Result in a Maybe, either a Just if the predicate is true, or Nothing.
      Parameters:
      predicate - the test to decide
      Returns:
      a Result containing a Maybe that may or may not contain a value

    • peek

      Result<T> peek​(Consumer<T> consumer)
      Provide the value within the Result, if it is a success, to the Consumer, and returns this Result.
      Parameters:
      consumer - the Consumer to the value if a success
      Returns:
      this Result

    • recover

      Result<T> recover​(Function<Throwable,​Result<T>> f)
      Provide a way to attempt to recover from an error state.
      Parameters:
      f - the function to recover from the error
      Returns:
      a new Result, either a Success, or if recovery is not possible an other Err.

    • onError

      void onError​(Consumer<Throwable> errorConsumer)
      A handler for error states.

      When this is an error then tne Consumer will be supplier with the error. When this is a success, then nothing happens.

      Parameters:
      errorConsumer - the consumer to handle the error

    • andThen

      <R> Result<R> andThen​(Function<T,​Callable<R>> f)
      Maps a Success Result to another Result using a Callable that is able to throw a checked exception.

      Combination of flatMap(Function) and of(Callable).

      
     Integer doSomething() {...}
     String doSomethingElse(final Integer value) {...}
     Result<String> r = Result.of(() -> doSomething())
                              .andThen(value -> () -> doSomethingElse(value));

      When the Result is an Err, then the original error is carried over and the Callable is never called.

      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the final Result
      Parameters:
      f - the function to map the Success value into the Callable
      Returns:
      a new Result

    • thenWith

      Result<T> thenWith​(Function<T,​WithResultContinuation<T>> f)
      Perform the continuation with the current Result value then return the current Result, assuming there was no error in the continuation. 
      
     Integer doSomething() {...}
     void doSomethingElse(final Integer value) {...}
     Result<Integer> r = Result.of(() -> doSomething())
                              .thenWith(value -> () -> doSomethingElse(value));

      Where the Result is an Err, then the Result is returned immediately and the continuation is ignored.

      Where the Result is a Success, then if an exception is thrown by the continuation the Result returned will be a new error Result containing that exception, otherwise the original Result will be returned.

      Parameters:
      f - the function to map the Success value into the result continuation
      Returns:
      the Result or a new error Result

    • reduce

      Result<T> reduce​(Result<T> identify, BinaryOperator<T> operator)
      Reduce two Results of the same type into one using the reducing function provided.

      If either Result is an error, then the reduce will return the error. If both are errors, then the error of this Result will be returned.

      Parameters:
      identify - the identify Result
      operator - the function to combine the values the Results
      Returns:
      a Result containing the combination of the two Results
